intro: Cerinthe major proles gymnandra, commonly known as the common cerinthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cerinthe major is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats.
